definition: theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe

sentences.english: My extracurricular activities include the Math and Drama Clubs.
sentences.chinese: 我的课余活动包括参加数学兴趣小组和戏剧社。

sentences.english: The Dramatic Society are doing 'Hamlet next year.
sentences.chinese: 戏剧社准备明年演出《哈姆雷特》。

sentences.english: The drama group did a sketch about a couple buying a new car.
sentences.chinese: 剧社上演了一出夫妻二人买新车的短剧。

sentences.english: We were together in the Thursday night drama society.
sentences.chinese: 我们过去总在星期四晚上的话剧社里聚会。

sentences.english: This Committee is responsible for running the society for the year.
sentences.chinese: 此委员会负责一年的剧社管理。

sentences.english: Join a choir or a drama club.
Really? I heard that it hadn't done that for years.
sentences.chinese: 真的？我听说戏剧社好几年没招过新人了。

sentences.english: Please enjoy the drama club rehearsals blue drama midsummer night's dream.
sentences.chinese: 请欣赏蓝天话剧社排演的话剧《仲夏夜之梦》。

sentences.english: Members of the society are eligible to attend all productions free of charge.
sentences.chinese: 剧社成员有资格免费参加所有演出。

sentences.english: At my school, the jocks never talk to the drama club crowd.
sentences.chinese: 在我们学校，运动员从不跟戏剧社的人讲话。

sentences.english: This is why his high school days were marked with a drama club membership, as well as the student council presidency.
sentences.chinese: 因此，他成为了学校戏剧社的成员和学生会主席。

sentences.english: My cousin enjoys acting, and she is a member of a drama club.
sentences.chinese: 我的表姐喜欢表演，她是剧社的成员。

sentences.english: I often go to the drama club.
We were together in the Thursday night drherehasa society.
sentences.chinese: 我们过去总在星期四早晨的话剧社聚会。

sentences.english: She decided to join the local dramatic society.
sentences.chinese: 她决定参加地方戏剧社。

definition: to perform (e.g. on the stage)/to lecture
to act (in a play)/to perform/to put on (a performance)/performance/concert/show/CL:場|场[chang3],次[ci4]
youth corps/youth wing of a political party
